Paragraphs: Having seen the quantity of restaurants in Paris without an online presence, I developed a system to quickly generate static websites for small businesses. During this time I learned the importance of business development, while maintaining technical excellence. The video below goes into some technical details of the system, which I have used to deploy this very website.

To learn the Angular front end framework, I coded a website that allowed me to see details of the exit maps of Metro stations. This was for my own personal use as I could not source the data needed in bulk, so I had fun collating the images based on the places I had visisted.
When the official website for displaying fixtures and tables for my hockey club was not mobile friendly, I wrote a simple skin that scraped the data and displayed it in a responsive format.
